* Main application class for the Faye task management system.

*

This class orchestrates the interaction between the UI, storage, and task list
* components to provide a command-line task management interface.
* Initializes a new Faye application instance.

*

Sets up the UI, storage, and loads existing tasks from the data file.

*

Processes user commands until the "bye" command is received.
* Handles all command types including list, mark, unmark, delete, todo,
* Exception thrown when an invalid task number is provided in a command.
* Creates a new InvalidTaskNumberException with the specified message.
* @param message Error message describing the exception.
* Parses raw user input into structured command data.

*

This class contains static utility methods for extracting the command word,
* index, and task descriptions from a full input line.
* Extracts the first word of the input as the command.
* Extracts a 0-based task index from commands like {@code mark 2}.
* @return 0-based index of the task referenced by the command.
* @throws NumberFormatException if the index token is not a number.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the input does not contain an index token.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the input does not contain
* Returns the text after the first space as the task description.
* @return Description text, or empty string if no description is present.
* Splits a deadline command description using {@code /by}.
* Splits an event command description using {@code /from} and {@code /to}.
* @return Array of parts split by {@code /from} or {@code /to}.
* Handles persistent storage of tasks to and from a file.

*

This class manages reading tasks from a data file and writing tasks
* back to the file in a specific format.
* Creates a new Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath Path to the data file for storing tasks.
* Reads data from the storage file and converts it to Task objects.

*

Creates the file and parent directory if they don't exist.
* Parses each line to reconstruct Todo, Deadline, or Event objects.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* Converts task objects into storage format and saves them to the file.
* @param tasks List of tasks to save.
* Represents a single task in the task list.

*

A task has a description and a completion status. Specific task types
* (e.g. Todo, Deadline, Event) extend this base class.

This class manages input/output operations, displaying messages and
* reading user commands from the console.
* Initializes the UI with a scanner for reading user input.
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println(" Yo Wassup my G! Yo friend Faye right here");
* Displays the goodbye message when the application exits.

System.out.println(" Now you have " + size + " tasks.");
